meanings.definition: A hydrocarbon found in pine resin.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the retene in the pine resin under a microscope.
meanings.sent2: The retene gives pine resin its distinct smell.
meanings.sent3: The retene in the pine resin whispered secrets to the trees.
meanings.sent4: The retene acted like a guardian, protecting the pine resin from harm.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the retene in the pine resin glowed like a tiny lantern.

meanings.sent1: She had to retene her excitement when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The dam was built to retene the flow of water in the river.
meanings.sent3: He tried to retene his laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The strong emotions were difficult to retene within him.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to retene the urge to burst into song during class.
